definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged

sentences.english: His client was a middle-aged man who lost his wife two months ago.
sentences.chinese: 他的当事人是一位两个月前丧偶的男性。

sentences.english: Some scruples and some reluctance the widower-father may be supposed to have felt;
sentences.chinese: 可以料想，那丧偶的父亲心里有些顾虑，有些踌躇。

sentences.english: Unmarried men are not wanted in the Sales Department , not even widowers.
sentences.chinese: 销售部不要未婚男士，甚至连丧偶的也不要。

sentences.english: I do not think he will ever get over the loss of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 我不以为他能克服丧偶之痛。

sentences.english: Bereaved women who exhibit their widowhood insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 对于守寡表现虚伪的丧偶妇女。

definition: to marry for the second time/second marriage/second spouse
to live as widow/to observe widowhood
to lose one's spouse (through marriage failure or bereavement)
